newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador rating to boost investment, help IMF talks.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador rating to boost investment, help IMF talks.

text.p: The B1 credit rating assigned to Ecuador's long-term foreign currency debt Thursday will help investment in the country and boost talks with the International Monetary Fund, Ecuadorean officials said.

Danilo Carrera, president of the country's policy setting monetary board, told journalists the rating "will serve to help in the talks with the IMF and with international banks on the necessary issues of international financing."
Moody's Investors Service assigned a B1 rating to Ecuador Thursday, putting it at the same level as Argentina and Brazil. It is Ecuador's first ever rating.
The rating "has important immediate positive effects for trade in Ecuadorean debt, for new loans and for new investments," Carrera added.
The ratings news coincided with a visit to the country by an IMF mission that arrived Monday to study the progress of Ecuador's economy with emphasis on its fiscal accounts.

"The strengths of the (government's) macro-economic program have been analyzed by the IMF mission...this opens the possibility of arriving at an understanding with this important international organization," Central Bank General Manager Fidel Jaramillo told reporters.
